summary: This FBI 302 form documents an introductory video conference meeting on February 23, 2021, between a witness (referred to as 'witness') and the case team investigating Jeffrey Epstein. The witness was advised to obtain counsel and made a spontaneous statement about Epstein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Referred to as the subject of the captioned case; the witness spontaneously stated she thought he 'went a little crazy'.

events.title: Introductory Video Conference with Witness
events.description: The case team held an introductory video conference meeting with a witness to the Jeffrey Epstein investigation. The witness was advised to obtain counsel and made a spontaneous statement about Epstein.

locations.name: New York, New York, United States
locations.context: Location where the investigation activity (the video conference) was documented as taking place.

keyFacts: A witness was introduced to the Epstein case team via video conference on February 23, 2021.
The witness was advised to obtain legal counsel, and when she stated counsel was expensive, she was advised she could obtain court-appointed counsel.
The witness spontaneously stated she had never seen 'them' do anything but thought Jeffrey Epstein 'went a little crazy'.
The document is an FBI 302 form, which is a report of investigation, dated February 1, 2021.
The document notes it contains neither recommendations nor conclusions of the FBI and its contents are not to be distributed outside the receiving agency.
